intro: Leandra hirta, commonly known as the woolly leandra, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Leandra hirta is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
